results.title: [Hallucinations and vivid dreams by use of metoprolol].
results.text_hl: [@<m>DISEASE_Hallucinations</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006212 @@@Hallucinations@@@ and vivid dreams by use of @CHEMICAL_Metoprolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008790 @@@metoprolol@@@].

citations.NLM: Ahmed AI, van Mierlo PJ, van Waarde JA, Jansen PA. [Hallucinations and vivid dreams by use of metoprolol]. Tijdschr Psychiatr. 2010;52(2):117-21. PMID: 20146183

results.title: Metoprolol-induced visual hallucinations: a case series
results.text_hl: After a new physician switched her from @CHEMICAL_Metoprolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008790 @@@metoprolol@@@ to @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, the @<m>DISEASE_Hallucinations</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006212 @@@visual hallucinations@@@ ceased within four days.

citations.NLM: Goldner JA. Metoprolol-induced visual hallucinations: a case series J Med Case Rep. 2012 Feb 15;6():65. PMID: 22336000
citations.BibTeX: @article{22336000, title={Metoprolol-induced visual hallucinations: a case series}, author={Goldner JA}, journal={J Med Case Rep}, volume={6}, pages={65}}

results.title: Central nervous system side-effects with hydrophilic and lipophilic beta-blockers.
results.text_hl: Nightmares or @<m>DISEASE_Hallucinations</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006212 @@@hallucinations@@@ were reported by all @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ receiving lipophilic beta-blockers but by only three @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ receiving @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@.

citations.NLM: Westerlund A. Central nervous system side-effects with hydrophilic and lipophilic beta-blockers. Eur J Clin Pharmacol. 1985;28 Suppl():73-6. PMID: 2865153
citations.BibTeX: @article{2865153, title={Central nervous system side-effects with hydrophilic and lipophilic beta-blockers.}, author={Westerlund A}, journal={Eur J Clin Pharmacol}, volume={28 Suppl}, pages={73-6}}

results.title: Long-term clinical experience with atenolol--a new selective beta-1-blocker with few side-effects from the central nervous system.
results.text_hl: Of the 51 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ who complained of or showed side-effects from another beta-blocker, 80% were improved after changing to @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Tenormin@@@. Of the @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with side-effects from the central nervous system, 73% improved, especially those who complained of nightmares, @<m>DISEASE_Hallucinations</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006212 @@@hallucinations@@@, @DISEASE_Sleep_Initiation_and_Maintenance_Disorders @DISEASE_MESH:D007319 @@@insomnia@@@ or mild @DISEASE_Depressive_Disorder @DISEASE_MESH:D003866 @@@depression@@@.

citations.NLM: Henningsen NC, Mattiasson I. Long-term clinical experience with atenolol--a new selective beta-1-blocker with few side-effects from the central nervous system. Acta Med Scand. 1979;205(1-2):61-6. PMID: 367088
citations.BibTeX: @article{367088, title={Long-term clinical experience with atenolol--a new selective beta-1-blocker with few side-effects from the central nervous system.}, author={Henningsen NC and Mattiasson I}, journal={Acta Med Scand}, volume={205}, number={1-2}, pages={61-6}}

results.title: Propranolol-induced psychosis.
results.text_hl: When @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ was substituted for @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@, all @DISEASE_Psychotic_Disorders @DISEASE_MESH:D011618 @@@psychotic behavior@@@ resolved.

citations.NLM: McGahan DJ, Wojslaw A, Prasad V, Blankenship S. Propranolol-induced psychosis. Drug Intell Clin Pharm. 1984 Jul-Aug;18(7-8):601-3. PMID: 6745087
citations.BibTeX: @article{6745087, title={Propranolol-induced psychosis.}, author={McGahan DJ and Wojslaw A and Prasad V and Blankenship S}, journal={Drug Intell Clin Pharm}, volume={18}, number={7-8}, pages={601-3}}

results.title: Beta-blockers and central nervous system side effects.
results.text_hl: However, within this group of four drugs the incidence of these side effects is lowest with hydrophilic @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ and generally highest with @CHEMICAL_Pindolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D010869 @@@pindolol@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@.

citations.NLM: McAinsh J, Cruickshank JM. Beta-blockers and central nervous system side effects. Pharmacol Ther. 1990;46(2):163-97. PMID: 1969642
citations.BibTeX: @article{1969642, title={Beta-blockers and central nervous system side effects.}, author={McAinsh J and Cruickshank JM}, journal={Pharmacol Ther}, volume={46}, number={2}, pages={163-97}}
